caption: Wow is how I need to start this review, for a Waldorf Astoria I expected way better. I ordered the breakfast sandwich and what was delivered was a bland hamburger bun with a side of wilted arugula (see photo). The funny thing is it took 45 minutes to deliver this delicacy. 🤢 all three items ordered were awful and extremely bland and we were never asked for refills or checked on for anything. The funny this is that this meal was the price expected of Waldorf but I would have done way better to go to the local Waffle House. You guys can do better.

Halfway through breakfast I started having allergies... didn’t know why. Towards the end of breakfast when I started having an asthma attack I realized. The table behind me had a dog under their table between them. Both my kids and I are allergic. I didn’t realize this was a dog friendly restaurant. :(
What a great find, searched for a nice bar near me and ended up here. The staff is amazing, the atmosphere is cool, food was worth the price.

We made a reservation at 6pm on Monday for their fried chicken special. By 6:50 we left because the food still hasn't come despite the waiter telling us 3 times that the chicken was coming.  Atmosphere was nice, live jazz piano was pleasant for the first 30 minutes of our wait but he stopped playing as well.  50 minute wait for fried chicken is not acceptable in my books

Unfortunately, this establishment had the worst service I have experienced in my 6+ years living in New Orleans.  My fiance and I made a 6 o'clock reservation for to enjoy the "pre-theater" menu advertised, as we were to attend a 7:30PM show at the Orpheum Theater across the street. I arrived 10 minutes early, and my fiance was 4 minutes late. The hostess explained that I had apparently reserved a table for 4 instead of 2. I checked my e-mail confirmation of the reservation, which clearly stated "table for 2." I informed the hostess of this and showed her the reservation. Despite this error not being my fault, I was still made to feel as if I had in some way inconvenienced the hostess and there was a delay in seating us, despite there being several open tables.  We explained to the host and hostess that we were to attend the 7:30 show and were here for the pre-theater meal. Despite this, we waited 20 minutes before having to get up from our table and let the wait staff and hostess know that we had not even been greeted by a server. It was only after this that we were served water. Bread was not provided for our table until we specifically asked, about 1 half hour after being seated.  I asked to speak to a manager, but one never came. After we finally ordered, the food came out relatively quickly and all at once. The crispy duck was not crispy. We could not enjoy our meal, as we were rushing to finish and were frustrated by the poor, inattentive service. When we were finished eating, we stacked our plates and silverware neatly on the table to indicate that we were finished, and again, we waited. We ended up standing up at our table and looking around for someone to ask for our check. Dessert was not served, as we had to leave for the show, even though there would have been time to eat it. What was supposed to be a romantic dinner was definitively ruined, and unfortunately overshadowed our concert experience as well.  Our bill was reduced significantly, however, the night was still ruined. I hope that this isn't the status quo at this establishment, because I had high expectations and my experience here has left me angered and disappointed. If you're planning to attend a show at the Orpheum, consider eating somewhere else beforehand.
If you stay at the Roosevelt hotel the Fountain Lounge will not disappoint....great food and a relaxing atmosphere.  If you love scallops, they melt in your mouth, A+ highly recommend.
Great breakfast

Excellent service. I have never had such a fresh salad in my life, with fresh chicken, lettuce and croutons combined with the atmosphere and live music it was absolutely Divine! Tre was my server and he was very kind, well spoken and knowledgeable about wine. I will definitely visit again for my next trip in Nola. :)

My dad and I were in NOLA this past weekend and we weren't staying in the hotel but very closeby and we ate breakfast here twice and both times was excellent. The food was incredible, as was the service. We were able to make a reservation for 6 of us on Sunday before the Saints game, and we made reservations the night before. My dad and I loved walking through the lobby and checking the place out. I had the blue crab and crawfish omelet on Friday and on Sunday we did the amazing buffet. Gerryelle was our waitress and she was so nice and helpful. A great experience, thank you.
Beautiful lounge... Overpriced food that was only okay
Very tasty food
Nice hotel bar

Arguably the worst restaurant I've been to in New Orleans and I've been to quite a few. Now for the only good news; the atmosphere was pretty nice to look at and the server was great...the end of the good news. Now take a journey with me as I break down why I started with a 5 star rating to a 1 star.  As I stated previously the atmosphere is lovely, I do have a minor gripe about the tables being too long for two people to talk to each other. I know it sounds petty but trust me you will notice it.  On to more serious matters; the place is expensive. Google has it listed as a "$$" it really should be a "$$$" listing. Don't get me wrong, if a place can back up its price I'm all for it but unfortunately they failed to justify their steep prices. Starting with the bread which was extremely crunchy and difficult to consume. Followed by brussel sprouts that were deep fried which I have to problem with. Where they lost me at was how it tasted so greasy as if they left it sitting in grease too long. Not to mention the fact that it wasn't remotely crunchy even though it was deep fried. I literally could see the grease harden and turn white as it cooled down. It was also incredibly bland and desperately needed salt.  The dinner faired no better. We ordered two seafood entrees. Well we found out where all the salt was missing from the brussel sprouts. Both dishes were so salty that it literally...no kidding...started to burn our mouths. For some reason I felt bad and didn't want to tell our server that the main course was bad too so I powered through and regretted it greatly.  The experience was so bad that we went somewhere else just to cleanse our palate. I wasn't planning to drink that night but it was so bad I decided to have a drink. I should have known it wasn't a good place when it was so eerily empty and the restaurant right next to it was packed.  I'm a pretty nice guy. Fairly lenient and forgiving but I can't look past all the faults of this place and give it more than one star. Bar far the worst place I've eaten and my longest review. Please, for your own sake and the sake of your loved ones stay away. Feel free to take an enemy though.
Great live music on Monday and Carl's fried chicken is hands down the best in the city. Perfect spice blend and juicy plump chicken pieces!
Avocado toast was really good
Good food.
I live it!

We stayed in the hotel over the long Easter weekend and had breakfast here and was very disappointed! The service was not good at all and although there were only maybe four tables occupied in the entire restaurant we still had to wait a very long time for everything and I finally had to flag someone else down just to pay our bill!! I had ordered the eggs Benedict and it was awful! The Hollandaise sauce was way too lemony and it was almost curdled and the english muffin was dry and stale,and the eggs were not done and the white was runny! Instead of the sweet potato hash, I got a side of grits and they were flavorless and way too runny! My husband got the eggs your way and they scrambled and not done and also had no flavor. We were very disappointed in the quality of food, and yet we were charge an extraordinary amount for food we couldn't eat! The server could not have cared less about our complaints! Please avoid this place. I don't often leave bad reviews, but felt this needed to be posted.

I usually do not write bad reviews unless the experience was warrants it. I heard about this place from a friend who raved about how great the chicken was, how hot the chicken was, and how great the experience was for them. So i decided that I would venture there first Monday I had a chance to.Based on what I was told I had very high expectations and never once thought my experience would be any less than superb. Needless to say and judging by the rating, that was not the case.  And I'll just cut to the chase with it. Dinner is from 5-9pm here. So we arrived about 7:30-ish. Only thing on the menu on Mondays is Chef Carl's fried Chicken and that's exactly what I wanted. I should have taken pictures since seeing is believing. When the chicken and biscuits arrived, the chicken was dark (looked as though it had been sitting under the light after thinking about it later) and the biscuits were a dark brown, which I didn't really mind. Normally, I would send food back immediately, but I thought this must be the way its supposed to be. Moreover, the chicken was lukewarm, at best and the biscuits were hard and dry. Moments after the beans and coleslaw arrived. They were the stars of the night. The chicken was a mix of salty, spicy, and flavorless (besides cayenne pepper). it probably won't have been so bad if the chicken was at least hot. Hot food always tastes better than lukewarm of cold food. Amen!  My disappointment was heightened when I observed the tables surrounding me receive fresh golden brown chicken and oh my god, freshly baked beautifully buttered biscuits. This prompted me to ask if I could get another biscuit and man when I did, it was a totally different experience. That one biscuit almost changed my life. It was so soft and delicious (so THEY DO EXISTS) I almost ordered a whole other basket of chicken in hopes of an all together different experience. but I resisted because that would have been a risk that only cost me more money. And for the record, I asked my waitress about the chicken and expressed my displeasure and she pretty much shrugged her shoulders and walked away. I felt halfway ignored. to top it all off the beer that you get with your food (which we both ordered the Amber) was FLAT.  Summary: My experience was void of golden brown, piping hot chicken and biscuit. Chicken was salty and had too much cayenne pepper with little evidence of other seasonings.  The bright spots about this place were the sides(red beans and coleslaw) live music and the AMBIANCE.
Good food and good, polite service.
Great place to go before an event at The Saenger.
a hidden in plain sight gem of a joint! live music, great good, excellent service! will definitely return.
Disappointed.  Eggs not prepared as requested.  Toast arrived at the completion of meal.

We had a large group and they did ok keeping up with us.  They had some of the best Gumbo in NOLA that I had and their NY Steak was cooked perfectly and was absolutely incredible!  I will go back for that steak!
Sazerac

A bustling upscale lounge at the Roosevelt Hotel. Visited on a Friday night with friends to try the pris fixe Reveillon menu. Excellent meal in a lively room with a skilled staff and music from their pianist. Always busy around the holidays with the evening crowd plus the visitors to see the decorations, we still enjoyed a leisurely meal and lingered over drinks.

We loved this cozy Lounge!!! Food was excellent as well as the service!!! The grand piano and singing was excellent!!! The breakfast was also very delicious! I can hardly wait to  come back to New Orleans and back to the Fountain  Lounge!
really good eggs Benedict

April was our waitress and she was super sweet! My husband and I just stopped in for a snack (we both got the goat cheese salad) and a couple drinks and everything was delicious! The place is pretty pricey, but as long as you are prepared to drop some cash on a nice meal and/or drinks, I would definitely recommend this place. But our waitress was too notch. The service was spectacular,  all around.
Great service, and great good. The fried chicken special on Monday evenings is amazing.
Wagyu beef over-charred.
Never dissatisfied. Such a great place to have a few drinks, eat, and listen to good music. Props to Michael, the manager.
Service was slow but the food was good.
Lovely. The Roosevelt is beautifully decorated for Xmas which made the stop for a Sazarac all the better!
Lovely atmosphere, service and tasty selections.
Super friendly staff, great pianist, beautiful room and Carl's Fried Chicken (on Mondays) is to die for!  Carl is so nice he came to the table. Go get some for yourself!!
The food was great! The staffs were very friendly. It's a great place for dates.
The Coolinary menu is great!

The food was great and the fried oyster salad really sold me. You are definitely getting your money's worth. Some things are a little pricey but that depends on what you have a taste for. The servers and my host Patricka was a joy and didn't hesitate to help me choose the best options. They made me feel at home. Definitely coming back!
AMAZING service!!! The waiters were awesome and very entertaining.  Great food and Tre was the best waiter we've had on our trip to the big easy! Can't wait to come back.
The menu includes shrimp scampi appetizer for the table that three shrimp is $19 the fatty version with trovadfiyion shrimp and nothing else is $34...really

A beautiful selection of wine and suggested pairings with fresh seafood and prime cuts of meat.  This restaurant and bar is located in The Roosevelt Hotel with live music, strings base - beautiful restaurant.
